text: Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. Thick, beige head, abundant lacing, dark brown, nearly black color. Aroma of chocolate and dark roasted malt. Mouthfeel is thick with a warming alcohol in the finish. Flavor is intense - chocolate, molasses, dark fruit, dark roasted barley, with matching intense hop flavors. Overall: if you like big, intense, complex beers this is definitely one to try.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Original review from years ago accidentally deleted. Updated review:  Canned 2021 (2 years ago)  Appearance: Pours a completely black, color with a moderate and thick dark tan head. SRM of 24. (4.00)  Aroma: Strong and smooth aromas of rich dark chocolate, somewhat bittersweet with a sweet bourbon, bread, and caramel flavor. (4.00)  Flavor: Dark, smooth, rich and sweet flavors of dark chocolate, rich bread, caramel, strudel, some scotch and bourbon to finishes malty. Minimal roast. (4.25)  Feel: Heavier bodied, average carbonation. Smooth, thick, rich, heavy, and sweet. (4.25)  Compared to Great Lakes Blackout Stout 2/2023: Pours similar, darker head. Similar aromas. More thick and heavy chocolate with malt complexity of bread pudding and caramel. Less coffee and roastedness. Heavier and sweeter.  Overall: Tried this one a few times and unfortunately my review was accidentally deleted so cannot look back on previous reviews. Now I'm drinking this one from 2021 in 2023 so aged a couple of years. It's rich, heavy, and thick. Some complexity to the malt flavors of chocolate, dark meat, bread pudding, and caramel. Shows the booze a bit. Thick, heavy, and sweet.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Deep black pour with a small brown ring that is hanging around. Roasted malt nose with a decent amount of ethanol. Super smooth, perfectly equal creamy and a bit of carbonation. Delicious, classic stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12 oz bottle packaged 9-7-22. I’ve had this many times. First time review. Poured into a snifter a beautiful thick black with a 1” head. Smell is hard to tell. A little too cold, being in fridge, don’t have the greatest nose. Taste is great. Full flavored chocolate a a little licorice. Very hearty. Feels great in the mouth. Almost chewable. I like to sip these over a long time and let them warm up. One of my favorite Russian Imperial Stouts. Highly recommended.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Purchased a bottle of this beer while in Pittsburgh. Poured into a tulip glass. Richdark brown with a beautiful cream brown head and excellent lacing. Smell and taste of high quality dark chocolate. Earthy and very malty, mellow, warming and slightly boozy. Very silky smooth. Creamy feel. Very nice stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Expedition Stout from Bell’s Brewery. 12 oz bottle. Stored at 34 degrees at home. Received from @Whyteboar in NBW BIF #16. Reviewed 16/12/22. Note that I use DD/MM/YY protocol. Bottle marked on back label “Shelf Life – Unlimited” also “PKG 09/20/2022). Served at 53.4 degrees in a hand washed and dried Jester King snifter. The final temperature was 56.1 degrees. Appearance – 3. First pour – Amber Brown (SRM 18), nearly opaque. Body - Ruby Brown (SRM 24), opaque. Under direct light, same. When rear lite, opaque but some light penetrates the edges – ruby. Head – Average (Maximum one cm, aggressive center pour), copper, high density, quickly diminishing to a 0.15 cm crown with a thin, partial cap. Lacing – None. Aroma – 4.5 – Medium roasted malt with light char, and hints of chocolate, no hops, no yeast. Flavor – 4.5 – Flavor follows the nose – roasted malt, slightly bitter, no hops, no yeast. No ethanol (10.5 % ABV as marked on label) aroma or taste. Marked gastric warming occurs. No dimethylsulfide or diacetyl. Palate – 4 – Medium, slightly creamy, soft carbonation. Final impression and summation: 4 Looks like every other RIS. Flavor is typical for the style, without the coffee notes many RIS have. Aroma is also typical.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Due to ABV split this 12 ozer with my son in law. Dark dark dark in color. Exceptional taste up front and nothing weird on the finish. ABV disguised so well it’s crushable but at your own peril. Will cellar one or two from this sixer. Well priced at 16.00 for six
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Procured in a proxy/trade hybrid with @turkeysdrinkbeer in February 2022, and drunk nine months later in November 2022.  L: Poured like oil out of a can, with a thick, shiny stream of silky-looking liquid issuing forth. In the glass, it's blacker than black, with the brownest, most coffee-coloured head I've ever seen. Lots of tiny bubbles race their way up the edge of the glass.  S: Roasty, rich caramel and molasses, with strong umami soy sauce notes.  T: The taste is smooth and roasty at the same time. There's a creaminess and a Christmas cake note evident throughout. The booze is strongly evident. At the end there's a lingering retronasal coffee note. This beer is delicious!  M: The beer is smooth, thick and oily, but all in a good way. It coats every part of my mouth, with a delightful satiny feel. This part of the beer ties everything together like the prettiest Christmas bow and turns a delicious beer into an outstanding one.  O: This one blew me away. I was tired after a poor sleep the night before and the last thing I wanted was a big stout. But I'm a stubborn man, and for once in my life, my mulishness has paid off. What a great beer this is!  Cheers! #152
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: New to me, and a solid daily drinker; for an RIS, to me at least! I use Old Rasputin as my benchmark, but this one is not expensive and delivers on flavor! Unlike the famous ones that have 10% more flavor and 50% more cost. Dark pour from chilled bottle in to 12oz. pint glass. Some head, decent. Motor oil consistency; can't see through it. Just a hint of fruit sweetness, but not overly so. Not sure where the sweetness comes from, but it is muted. Great roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, malty flavor. Nice mouthfeel; just about right for RIS. This has some smokiness to it (for me), and I love that. It has both a bit of sweet and bitter finish. But walks the line pretty well here; not going overly one direction. Nice after dinner drink by the fire!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: If you’re looking for a really thick, heavy beer, this is it. I like Guinness and Leine’s dark (among others), but this one is a bit thick and heavy for me. It certainly has chocolate tones.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: L - Deep black with a tan head that dissipates somewhat quickly leaving behind a thin cap and some lacing S - Roasted malts, dark chocolate, and some dart fruit. Smell is pretty faint however T - roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark fruits, some molasses, some hop notes. Some charred notes. Hints of coffee. F - full bodied, light carbonation. Smooth. O - a well done, yet simple imperial Russian stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12 oz bottle, born on 11/11/19, poured into a snifter at 55 degrees F: L - dark and silky with a head that quickly dissipated S - molasses, hint of roasted malt, chocolate T - Roasted malt, molasses, char, dark chocolate, coffee, lot's going on F - thick mouthfeel minimal carbonation O - excellent, my favorite Bell's beer
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Found this one in our local grocery store known for a manager who loves his brews. After opening the first bottle, I immediately lifted the bottle to my nose. The aroma of a malting barn hit me. The heavy, rich, sweet aroma took me back to my days baling wet hay on the family farm. Organic, real, substantive, with sweet smells. Very few beers have hit me this way. The taste was rich and full. I may have found the beer to replace Dragon’s Milk as my second favorite after Founder’s KBS.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: One seriously tasty brew. I haven’t tried it much due to the price point but I think that’s been my loss. Bottled 9/21 consumed 10/21. Great now but what might happen w time? L: from the bottle. Classic stylish. S: coffee chocolate. Toffee? Nice! T: almost smoky. Bittersweet chocolate. Lots of bitterness. Powerful. I like it. F: kind of forgot about it. Nice but after the taste who cares? O: helluva offering. Worthy!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled 9/3/20. Poured at 57°. Ink black; one finger of dark tan mixed bubbles head quickly dissipates leaving a small filmy island and solid ring; spots of lace and thick legs on swirl. Nose is roast malt, chocolate and coffee. Roast bitterness, char and burnt brown sugar up front; bittersweet dark chocolate, chocolate brownie batter; raisins; roast coffee as beer warms; star anis and molasses on backend. Medium full body, moderate minus carbonation; some warmth from 11.5% abv; dryish finish. Overall, layers of flavors, however, at almost one year old the char/bitterness is still strong with a long bitter linger; a tasty RIS, yet more bitter roast than I want…it would be interesting to see how this beer tastes in a few years.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Black beauty with a nice tan head. Unusually complex flavor profile brings chocolate and dark fruit on parade for your palate. It is hearty, in your face, yet smooth and beautifully blended.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottle conditioned. Cellared since 2015. Almost black with a dark tan, frothy head which recedes to a lasting thin layer. Rich aroma of chocolate, coffee with dark rum and raisin fudge. A bittersweet cacophany of flavours reflecting the bouquet. Charred bitter finish. Full in body. Viscous. Soft carbonation. Deserves the accolades.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Had it a few nights ago. Have had it before. Delish Imp Stout. Mapley, molasses notes.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass  Look: Opaque pitch black with a thick mocha head  Smell: Rich bittersweet coffee, hops, coffee,  Taste: Big bold bittersweet coffee up front that gets blasted away by bitter floral and pine hop that stick to the palate and slowly fades to notes of coffee and honey toast  Feel: Big and rich. Not cloying but still clings to the palate with bold bitterness. Medium alcohol. Good carbonation.  Overall: A Russian imperial stout that isn’t afraid to show off the hoppy side of the style. Solid.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This beer pours black. Like jet black. Brown head that is 1.5 fingers thick. Fades to long lasting lacing. The flavor is bold. Black licorice and bitter coffee. Mouth feel is thick. Everything about this is bold. Very bold. Too much for with a meal. Just about a meal by itself.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: For a non-BA aged stout this one really rocks. True to its style in taste and smell. Dark as midnight. Pours with a nice dark tan head about 1.5 fingers thick that dissipates fairly quickly to leave a thin covering over the beer for the duration or time it takes to bottom the glass. a little lacing left behind. My smell/taste differentiation capabilities are not sufficient to discern individual components very defensibly, but there is a bit of bitter dark chocolate I pick up with an overall incredibly well balanced taste and mouthfeel that leaves me to conclude "I have no idea what contributes to this flavor but it sure is good". I need to get more of this and cellar it and ration it out until it is reissued next year.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This has a really strong coffee scent up front and then the malts start marching in.   It has a strong rich coffee taste that turns a little woody. Then it turns sweet with malt.  This shit is thick. It's mouthfeel is a mouthful.  It's smooth with not a lot of carbonation. It finishes with some bitterness and a little burn from the high alcohol content.  Overall this is a great imperial stout. It's strong and flavorful.  Overall I give it a 5.2 out of 6.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Appearance: Ink black, two finguhs of tan head. Smell: Espresso, tobacco, raisin, brownie batter. Taste: Massive flavor. Melted dark chocolate, loads of singed brown sugar. Espresso, bittersweet dark fruits and a toasty finish. Feel: Like God. Overall: Consume me, o' vastness of what lies before me. May I be reborn in your own very image.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: one of my most favorite beer, malt bitter chocolate larchy toast and heat room temp from glass 2020 bottle stashed two bottles for one year & two year to try.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pretty nice example of a Russian Stout. Alcohol hidden extremely well. Hints of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, blah blah blah, you know what a stout tastes like. This is just one of the better examples. $13.50 at Total Wine, so not overpriced for an 11+. Try it, you'll like it. ✌
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: A Russian Imperial Stout. It tastes dark, from Somewhere else. It's a wonderful counter to hopped-up IPAs. Malty and smooth and tasty. The ABV is sneaky. I really like this one. If you are thinking of trying dark, try this beer.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Purchased at Jungle Jim's. They had several aged Bell's beers on sale. Bottle dated 11/05/15 (4-1/2 years old) Pours pitch dark with a thin head that disappears almost immediately. Very nice, I enjoyed it.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Oily black in color with a viscous appearance. Poured with a short, dark beige foam with low retention. Rich, roasted malt aromas, dry dark chocolate, sweet dark malt, with notes of black coffee and dark fruit. Full bodied with a lush, rich feel and low carbonation. Dark roasted malt flavors up front with sweet dark grainy malt beneath. Medium light bitterness through the middle. Boozy bite transitions off the mellow bitterness followed sweet dark chocolate, dark fruit, roasted malts and mellow, tasty, lighty charred malts near the end. Finished dryly with tapering rich roasty malt flavors, dark fruit, and very light charred malt notes. Aromatic, rich, malty, mellow booziness, smooth....wow, this was fantastic.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This is for a bottle that was capped in November of 2015 and opened on May 1, 2020, so take that for reference. Pulled the 12 oz bottle from my cellar where it was stored at 54 degrees and poured it into a snifter. Aroma - I can smell this one! Mmmm, stout like malts and slight coffee nuance with what I can only describe as a hint of graham cracker, which seemed odd to me, but there you have it. Appearance - If the color black had a temperature, this would be a warm black. Virtually no head, very light umber colored lacing. Very opaque. Taste - Very good. Need to compare with 'fresh' for comparison, but this was outstanding. Roasted malts roll over your tongue and down your throat with the hops kicking in at the back of the palate for a slight edge. Warmth accompanies the entire process. Overall - Excellent example of the genre. The malts carry the hops, not the other way around like I've tasted in some. Definitely a permanent occupant in the cellar.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured into a tulip glass from 12 oz bottle. Bottled 9/10/18 and enjoyed 5/2/20. Color is deep, dark, near black, 1/3 inch of foam, which quickly dissipated into a stubborn almond-colored ring, and a few islands. Smell of espresso, merlot and sweet fresh-baked bread. Tasted of coffee and vanilla, sweet. can taste the alcohol. Lightly carbonated and sharp in the mouth, a slight burn down the throat, a smooth and sugary finish.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: had this one put away since Nov 2018. aged well , strong malt taste , taste stays w ith you head was creamy -
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: I had this beer for the fist time during the 3rd stay home week in April. I recall the look, smell & taste, but don't remember much after that. Not sure if I was exhausted from day or the beer was that good. Either way, I am going to have to try it again.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Very solid Russian Imperial Stout.  Smells and looks great but a little harsh at first taste and throughout. Would prefer a little more sweetness.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Picked up a bottle of the 2015 vintage from the Argonaut in Denver. Never before have I aged a beer for more than two years, so this is a first experience for me. Thanks for cellaring this, guys. As the bottle description suggests, this brew was meant to be aged...  The pour reveals a dark brown espresso body with just enough mocha brown foam to leave a thin dotted line of lacing on the glass. Nice, but this isn't where it shines.  The aroma is sweeter than I remember this stout being fresh, molasses at the forefront with notes of roast coffee and dark chocolate close behind. Hints of coconut, vanilla, and dried bread crusts complement the syrupy molasses base, which fades into turbinado sugar and fresh tobacco for a very mellow finish.  Tastes very smooth compared to the fresh version. The roast bitterness has diminished into an ashy charcoal flavor. The molasses, on the other hand, only seems to have been strengthened with age, becoming the primary player in the game dark chocolate is still a competitor, as is (what I can only describe as) aged coffee, which holds just enough bitterness to balance the rather prominent coffee acidity, and the overall impression is a lightly carbonated Irish coffee with invisible cream that someone left out all day.  As ridiculous as that sounds, it's actually really smooth, with a creamy onset and a dry charcoal finish. The feel of this brew has definitely improved with age.  I can't say I'm blown away. It's still very much the same beer, and considering the lack of roast bitterness, I don't know if I could say I prefer it aged for five years. I would like to try a fresh one again before I make such an assessment. But it's still delicious after half a decade on the shelf, and I will probably pick up another one at $3 a bottle, just to do a side-by-side. Cheers!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Looking over my ageing stash during these times of distancing and there was no distancing from this beauty. The color was dazzling in the glass. The elements of the taste profile sharply defined and combining in moments. Bourbon barrel syrupy smoke and dry earth with cocoa and coffee hints that converge quickly with the malts and leave you stunned by the richness and balance. As a Stout drinker for 50 years or so, I rate this Brewer and his Brew as Galaxy on the Interplanetary Scale. Hopefully I have stashed another.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: I had a bottle dated 10/2018. Pours black with a small short lasting tan hear.  Smells of malt and coffee. Tastes of chocolate and the previous two. Has a bitter finish which diminishes after it has been in the glass a while. Less sweetness than other imperial stouts that I have tried. Hides its alcohol well.  Medium body and carbonation.  Enjoyable. Seeing the brewer's notes make me wish that I cellared it longer.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a Dogfish Head tulip  L: Black pour with 2 fingers of thick foamy tannish head. Great retention and lacing.  S: Roasted grains, burned sugars, light espresso, and dark cocoa. Checks all the boxes.  T.F: Sweet roasted sugars and burned malts to start. Dark chocolate, roast, baked raisins, and espresso. Medium bodied... sticky on the tongue. More roasted malts at the finish. Super mellow after 2 years in the cellar.  O: A very well executed Russian Imperial. Great flavor and drinkability. Now I gotta get ahold of the barrel-aged version as I'd imagine this does great in oak.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours a jet black with normal carbonation. head fades pretty quickly, aroma is of roast, coffee, malt. Taste is much the same, but everything is very balanced. A nice bitterness but no flavor stands out too much.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured into a 16 oz. tumbler. Dark/Black/Oily! Awesome stout! Look: Midnight Black Smell: Espresso, molasses, roasted oats. Taste: Bread pudding, strong coffee, smooth Feel: Full bodied and satisfying Overall: One of if not my most favorite Russian Imperial Stout! I'll be having this one again!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: I was unable to find this for the longest of times.  L: 4.5 Opaque black with a dark tan head. S: 3.5 Typical RIS. Molasses. licorice. Hops. T: 4.5 Chocolatey. Roasted coffee. Bitter hops. F: 4. Thick but silky. Good carbonation. A warmer for sure. O: 4.25 Great Russian Imperial. Definitely would get some more.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Very dark appearance with slight tan head. Aroma is a very pleasant malt and raisin. Taste is also a pleasant malt and raisin. This is one of the best non-barrel aged beers I have had.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Too hop forward for the style for me
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Striking look, pouring inky and opaque with the darkest head I've ever seen. The smell is sort of bitter and sour. Solidly balanced, buttery rich beer. Incredibly satisfying feel. Devastatingly complex. So many layers to unpack with every taste.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12 oz bottle. Pours black with tall, long lasting, creamy, brown head and nice lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, toast, dark fruit, chocolate and brown sugar. Body is full, creamy and smooth. Taste is of nutty, toasted malt, coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, dark fruit, spices and herbal hops. Finish is long and very bitter. Great brew.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Sets the gold standard for Russian imperial stout. Rich huge flavors of dark roasted malts, dark fruits, dark coffee, dark chocolate. Very creamy and thick mouthfeel. Aroma matches the flavors. Big finish of bitterness from hops. I’m very impressed with the intensity of the flavors! Having no added flavors I haven’t had a better straight RIS. A++ bottled 18 days ago. I’m glad I got a 6 pack-5 will be cellared and enjoyed at various ages!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: From a bottle packaged 8/30/19. Pours black with a thin layer of brown head. Roasted malt and chocolate smell. Very smooth feel and medium body. Dark malt, dark chocolate, and some strong bitter hops. Absolutely delicious!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Update from original review in 2020. bumped the smell rating up because it smells delicious from very far away. pours dark dark brown with a small rich looking head which dissipates quickly to a ring around the glass on the nose is chocolate and tobacco. strong hint of booze taste dark chocolate bitter with flashes of sweet. some dark fruit. lots of heavily toasted malts a quick bit of carbonation on the front end. heavy and super rich, quite dry. This brew is packed with flavor Set two aside for cellaring.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This beer will keep you busy. Multifaceted in aroma, taste and appearance. Poured from a 12 oz. bottle dated 9/18 enjoyed 12/13/19. L: I love the deep dark almost black color contrasting with the rosy brown head. Very nice lacing as well. S: The aroma is complex, in a good way. I first note a sweetness; almost molasses in quality. I picked up malty, toasty smells as well as espresso and dark chocolate. T: the front of my tongue picks up the sweetness mentioned in the smell, mid palate it’s bakers chocolate, maybe coffee as well and the bitterness of the hops comes shining through. F: This is a heavy, thick beer; very solid body. Maybe slightly heavier than I prefer but I respect it for what it is. O: This is a really special beer. I wouldn’t want to drink it frequently but it’s a great sipper, especially given the high ABV. I’m really glad I tried it and I will tuck the other 5 away in my cellar to age a bit more.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: To each their own. Too bitter for me packaged 10/2018 drank 12/2019 so I don't know how long you would need to age it, to tame the bitterness. Still aside from that for me a pretty well made beer. Creamy like a chocolate shake
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Metal, boozy, too bitter and leave a very unpleasant after taste, coffee, malty, thick,
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Marvelous imperial stout. No quirky extras... just hits the brew on the head. Beautiful mocha colored head and brown black body. Deep balanced flavor. Ages well? I'm sure I will never know.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Age: 1 yr. $80 a case in Pennsylvania. Beautiful appearance. Rich, thick head. Completely black in color. I don't think it was as bitter as some other reviewers have noted. 10% alcohol appears well masked. Best served not super cold as it builds in complexity with warmth. Can't wait to cellar this for a few years. Fantastic!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: has this clear sweetness coming from the malt and bitterness too, which I don't really like.  otherwise, it's a pretty decent beer.  it doesn't have the coffee, chocolate, and other flavors in Founders Breakfast or the complexity and deliciousness coming from a barrel aged stout  and the bitterness sort of reminds of Stone dark beers - which I'm not a fan of  So...if you like the bitterness of stone and don't really care about the complexity and other flavors from a Founders style, I think this beer is for you
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Outstanding, one of the best. Truly delicious. Seems to be a perfect beer for this style.  Color is super black, smell is delicious, taste is silky smooth. High alcoholic content not a factor at all, it is there but does not feel it.  Everything you would want from a RI stout is here.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12 oz. bottle poured into tight nonic (10/31/2017 born-on date ... almost two years old from my "cellar" aka my fridge)  L: classic black-and-tan look with the beer being almost pitch black and the massive head of foam being a dark tan, almost brown; as it pours, it looks like motor oil coming out of the bottle, and the head percolates like a nitro beer; the sticking off the head of foam is modern-art quality; it's one of the the most amazing pours you'll ever see and the easiest 5 I've scored  S: chocolate, both lighter, sweeter milk and more bitter dark; a faint note of old burnt hops  T: bitter dark malt — it's bitter enough that the hops still could be nipping and biting, but it's also a burnt bitter; baker's chocolate, espresso, brown sugar, a hint of meaty/bold red wine that gets cut off by the dark-malt bitterness; occasionally the chocolate flavors get sweeter, moving from baker's to dark to a hint of milk chocolate  F: fat, thick, oily and well carbonated; at times you feel like you could eat it with knife and fork, but it's still beer and mostly water, and there is a nice break from the thickness from time to time and it almost feels a bit watery; a fun complexity and more often than not exactly what you expect from the style  O: even at two years old, it's still strong, dark and bitter; in fact, it's a bit too bitter to my tastes; it's tasty and enjoyable, but it could've aged another two years and still been fine, perhaps even losing some of the burnt bitterness and tasted more like roasted coffee and dark chocolate; if you like your Russian imperial stouts on the truly dark side, this one fits the bill
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Good beer. Even after aging a bit bitter for my liking but still solid. Tastes like chocolate and coffee. Drinkable - very solid and recommended. Definitely age it..
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Possibly my favorite non barrel aged imperial stout along with Darkness. I held a blind taste test with friends and this came in second to Darkness among the group vs 7-8 comparable stouts. I’ve had a 22 year old bottle of this tastes amazing before. This stout is legendary. I love the bitterness and complexity. I will always try to have some on hand.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from a 12oz bottle dated 8/19/18 to a diagonal cut tumbler. Pours opaque brown/black with a one finger brown head. Aroma is rich, reminds me of chocolate covered cherries with brandy inside. This is a complex beer, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, cherries, brandy maybe a touch of smoke, I don't normally like sweet stouts, and this isn't sweet except maybe by my standards, but I like this a lot. The mouthfeel is full tongue coating, sticky. This viscosity and surface tension nicely but temporarily coats the glass with each sip. A new beer for my stout list for sure.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Served around 50 degrees and sipped slowly. Pours near-black with a thin tan head. The nose is dark chocolate, roast, and pine with a savory edge and a faint metallic note. The taste is dark chocolate, coffee, and cherry with a light hit of booze and bitter pine on the finish. The mouthfeel is a nice medium+. Overall, a tasty stout with herbal bitterness.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Absolutely delicious!  Pours an oily black with a kind of ice cream soda tan head that dissipates in a couple minutes leaving tan lacing. Smell is dominated by malty chocolate, bit of dark fruit, bit of leather. Feel is creamy almost like ice cream.  Overall, it's very rich, almost dessert-like.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Chocolate dark tan colored head on this brew with and almost black beer. I get a sugar soda type smell from this one meh... flavor is a bit bitter with fleeting overripe fruits and maybe somewhat woody but pretty decent and hides the alcohol pretty well with a slight amount of heat felt. Thick brew here with more carbonation than you might expect. A bit different than other imperials I’ve had in a somewhat interesting way.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Too strong for me.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Smeels like cherries and goes down very smooth. Wow it is stong but doesnt feel boozy like most beers of this kind.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Look: impossibly dark, can't see through it. dark tan head that dissipates, but clings to the side of the glass for dear life.  Smell: wood shavings, redwood. burnt sugar.  Taste: unsweetened cocoa powder. alcohol kick is definitely present. dry like a white wine; some sweetness comes on the end though. redwood. unsweetened figs. a bit bitter. doesn't take like it's been kept ina bourbon barrel, tastes like it's been kept in a vodka barrel  Feel: where it really excels. it's thick like a chocolate milkshake, and really coats the tongue  overall: i was a bit disappointed. i can't get over the bitterness and the un-smoothness of the alcohol. I like a dry, less sweet stout, but this one is a bit harsh.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Beautiful. Nose of chocolate and mocha, vanilla. Delicious and sumptuous to drink (Carmel, mocha, dark chocolate, hazelnut). Between hot chocolate and espresso with heft. Full bodied. Winter beer for sure. I’m loving this and am going to buy more. Seek it out.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Big dark chocolate, dates, raisins, roasted malts, some char, some coffee, slight licorice, the mouthfeel is medium to full. There is a bottled on date on the back. The 10.5% abv is well melded. If you're a stout lover then you might love this. Cheers! A-
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: No other beer has the balance of being a thick and hearty body, and just a bit of sweetness. The sweet flavor isn't forced, and it isn't too much. It is obviously naturally a residual essence from great ingredients and brewing - not like other beers that throw blobs of coffee, chocolate, or whatever, and rely upon them for the primary taste. I should point out that this is not a beer for the meek. If you have ever had a bud, miller, coors, ... and thought "this is refreshing", this beer is too much for you to even watch someone pour from across the bar - and definitely too much flavor for you to handle. I discovered the beer decades ago, and haven't found a better beer since. #1 beer in the world.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This is a classic for a reason. So malty it’s crazy. Chocolate goodness. Super bitter for a stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 2016 vintage - Pours black with a creamy brown foam head. Smells like licorice, big bold dark fruit, black grapes, dark berries, blueberry, black cherry, toasted graham cracker, dark chocolate, caramel swirl, a little smoky, hint of vanilla, touch of herbal hop notes and a lingering dark coffee roast. Tastes rich and savory with dense dark baker’s chocolate, dark coffee roast, smoky, dark caramel, dark molasses, slight vanilla, toasted graham cracker, dark fruit, black grapes, blueberry, dark berries, black cherry, licorice, with a big herbal earthy hit from the hops. Feels medium bodied, creamy with smooth moderate carbonation. Overall a really nice Russian imperial stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured into a tall clear pint glass. Jet black in appearance, half finger of light brown head, moderate retention and lacing.  Aroma consists mainly of dark chocolate and fudge. Notes of cream, leather, licorice, char, dark fruits, wood, and espresso. Very pleasant.  Roasted notes and coffee beans upfront. Notes again much like the aroma, in the order of leather, licorice, char, and wood, while the sweeter malts are least prominent. Hops dominate and provide a pleasant spiciness. Feels really smooth and balanced.  Excellent stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 2013 bottle, taste of dried plum, raisins, fig. Excellent RIS.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Quite possibly the best Bell's I've had to date...  I found this beer to be surprisingly special. I wasn't really expecting much but that's usually the time when the unexpected happens. The unexpected was simply what I got with this - from a beautifully dark beer with late forming, tan head (another unexpected surprise) to the roasted malt smell with chocolate notes - all of this was a very good first impression. Mouthfeel was a bit watery but still medium-bodied with a taste that matched. Yes sir, this is something unexpected, and good.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Jet black opaque with a good fluffy head. As dark and evil looking as expensive nose is Immense roast chocolate malt with lots of coffee as well, deep and rich. Taste is prancingly bitter coffee malt with a hint of chocolate sweetness. Just a touch of sweet chocolate but this is overwhelmingly roast bitterness. Crazy complex, rich and flavor-packed. Palate is thick, heavy and oily. Good amount of carbonation fluffs it out on the tongue. Finish is long, dry and very bitter. Overall, as flavorful of a beer as I’ve had. Explosively toasty, warm and bitter.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: L — Pitch black in the glass with a half finger of light brown head produced with moderate pour. Good retention and great lacing S — Fudge, digestive bitters, leather, booze, umami, deep woodsiness T — Black licorice, chicory root, bittersweet chocolate, French roast coffee, herbaceous hoppiness, char, semi-sweet dark fruits F — Thick and chewy. Big mouthfeel, medium- carb. Long lasting, roasty finish O — A big, bitter, roasty RIS. Decent stuff, although like most of Bell's offerings, they haven't quite kept up with the current state of brewing in America. Good price  82/100
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Date from 10/2017 and opened the bottle a year later. It is a nice stout and I throughly enjoyed it. Prominent chocolate and licorice taste. After a year of aging, it still has a strong alcohol taste. I think another year or two of aging the stout would mellow it and make it even better. I would recommend buying a few bottles. I will buy again.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Jet black malt bomb of a Russian imperial stout. Boozy at 10%, heavy chocolate and deep fruit flavor. My favorite non barrel aged stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12-oz. bottle (PKG 10/11/18) needed a strong pour for a fat finger of coffee milk colored rocky froth with a few large bubbles. As the head slowly shrinks to a cap, layers of lace appear. Opaque polished ebony, just a hint of brown. Roasted malt and alcohol control the bitter smell with a fresh opened can of coffee and bakers chocolate in the background. The taste is bitter, dry and malty throughout as alcohol, chocolate and coffee blend in the rich middle without a lot of carbonation. The finish is dry and bitter. The malt, chocolate, coffee and boozy heat plus moderate spicy hops linger a while. Almost full bodied, smooth towards the end. Big, bitter and rich.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottle poured into a snifter  Jet back motor oil, one finger dense brown foam cap, some lacings  aroma of roasted malts, bakers chocolate, dark roast coffee  taste is roasted malts, bakers chocolate, espresso roasted coffee  creamy mouthfeel on the first sip but a bitterness lingers  Good beer
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: From a 12oz bottle dated 8/30/19 into a pint glass.  Pours as black as black can be with about two fingers of light brown head. Great retention and lacing.  Smell is a little muted but picking up some coffee and cocoa and just a little bit of alcohol. Not surprising for 10.5% abv.  Taste is similar to the nose. Some bitter coffee and dark chocolate. A touch sweetness and alcohol. Very well balanced taste-wise.  Overall, probably my favorite RIS-the one that got me into the style. Mouthfeel is thick, smooth and creamy-really wonderful.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12oz bottle dated 10/11/18.  Pours opaque black with minimal head or retention. Charred chocolate with hints of espresso and black licorice in the nose. Full bodied with an oily, viscous mouthfeel. Rich bakers chocolate, over-roasted coffee beans, and a robust intensity on the palate. Finishes with lingering chocolate and hints of booze, licorice, and char.  About as good as a non-BA stout gets. Quite pricey though at 3.60 per single.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: L: Pours pitch black with evident thick consistency. Didn't form much of a head but does retain a nice tan ring. Appealing amounts of lacing left on the glass. S: Barley, malts, molasses and figs are dominant aromas. Subtle bakers chocolate becomes more pronounced as it warms. Maybe its just me, but there is a slight tart/berry aroma as well. This beer smells like a delicious RIS. T: Full of roasted malt flavor with notes of chocolate, dates, figs, molasses, coffee and toffee. Bitter finish with lingering malty/chocolate sweetness. F: Thick and chewy consistency with a heavy body. Carbonation is spot-on for the style. Creamy smooth finish with just a slight fizz. O: This is a delicious brew. I am glad that it is starting to see some distro out in CA. I think I am appreciating it more among all the love of pastry stouts. It is nice to get back to the basics. It's delicious and is not boozy. It is full of character and flavor and lives up to its name. I am very glad to have tried and would buy again. Cheers!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: A: Pours a pitch black color with 2 fingers of head that fades down to a thin cap that leaves good lacing  S: Roasted malt, dark chocolate, espresso, and dark fruit. Lots of complexity  T: Follows the nose. Starts off with the roasted malt, espresso, dark chocolate and some bitterness and then goes into the dark fruit and a touch of alcohol. Finishes with lingering roast and bitter espresso  M: Medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation  O: A classic for a reason. A great RIS that makes for a good sipper. Very straight-forward RIS, but damn well done
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: L - Poured black with one finger mocha colored head. Mild ruby undertones. Good lacing. S - Roasted dark coffee and some chocolate notes. T - Deep coffee and some roast. A bit boozy. F - Full body mouthfeel. Smooth and creamy. O - A big beer in many ways. Deep flavors and smell, with a big punch. Warmed me up as it warmed up.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 11/3/18 (Okemos, MI): $17.55 w/ tax six pack 12 oz bottles purchased at a Kalamazoo Meijer. Bottled 8/29/18, poured into snifter. Dark black pour, light tan head with nice lacing. Chocolate malt aroma, creamy coffee taste, malt is excellent. Very rich creamy mouth feel, carbonation olds. Nice and smooth going down, overall very good pour.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours black with a finger and a half of dense, caramel-colored foam. Head retention is good. Aroma is big and malty, hitting roasty, toasty, nutty malts along the way. There is a little herbal and spicy hop action that livens up the aroma a bit, although it's still heavily focused and centered on dark malts. A light addition of chocolate and dark fruits rounds out the aroma. Flavor profile is caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, and dark fruits with roasted, toasted, nutty, and bready malts behind. Hops are more of a whisper here, but hit notes of herbal, spicy, and floral. Mouth feel is dense and thick with a velvety texture. Overall, a big stout with big malts and still perceptible hops. It's not overly complex or loaded with additional flavors, just a great straight-forward stout.  Served in a 12oz snifter from a 12oz bottle.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Solid deep black color with low to light carbonation. Body has a slight oily slick feel, above average thick heavy feel . Aroma is bitter black coffee,alcohol, mild amount of smoke and char. There's also a earthy,wood,and dried fruit aroma hidden deep in the aroma Taste is boozy, bitter black coffee upfront and it takes a while for that to subside to let the other flavors come through . All the other flavors do show up but the alcohol does dominate to some extent. Overall its complex,flavorful and really well made
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Looks jet black with a quickly receding mocha colored head, end of SRM index. Smells like burnt toffee, cacao nibs,booze. Taste is somewhat bitter,(as they state on the bottle) This is the only beer that seems intended to age. It says "Shelf Life-Unlimited" Good god an apocalypse beer!! Feels somewhat well put together. Not viscous or oily feeling. Overall I will try to stash a few bottles of this gnarly elixir. Intense experience but worthwhile.REVISION: After 90 days in the bottle there is a noticeable improvement in feel and taste.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Very dark with a foamy brown head. Hint of chocolate, but a very strong alcohol / cough syrup flavor that ruins it for me.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from 12oz bottle into glass. Bottled on date is '08/31/2016'. Black colored body, with a very thin mahogany edge when back lit. Half finger of tan head blooms at the end of the pour. Leaves behind an oily sheen of lacing that coalesces into scattered small spots. Aroma of deeply roasted malts, dark chocolate, peat, smoke, and tobacco. Taste is silky and spicy, with dark roasted malts, a range of chocolate from milk to dark, with a bit of smoke and a hint of dark fruit. Has a bit of peaty char deep into the after taste. Mouth feel is thick, mouth coating, and creamy. Some felt alcohol but certainly not a burn. Appropriate carbonation. Wonderful beer drinking experience, with rewards all through the taste profile (which is long and deep). This is a sipper beer because of all the nuances that can be discovered and savored, not because it is a challenging beer to drink.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This may be be the True North of Russian Imperial Stouts and all others are measured against.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled on 9/2015 sampled on 10/2018  Opened at fridge temp and allowed to warm in glass  Oily tan head that disapated into small lacing. Near black appearance. Smell of dried dark fruit, unami, some coffee bitterness, vanilla, and chocolate milk. Taste is of coffee bitterness and finish with some of those dark fruits and a nice milk chocolate flavor.  At three years, I can see this lasting at least another three in the bottle. Still a little bitter for my liking. Will revisit next year. I do not think unami flavors will over take the complexities of this beer anytime soon.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: From a 12 fl. oz. bottle with a bottling date of 09/10/18. Sampled October 20, 2018  It has a deep dark brown to almost black appearance with a small, silky, fading mocha head.  Despite it's higher ABV percentage the aroma em its little in the way of alcohol. It does bring out sensations of bold, dark roasted malts with some milk or vanilla and a mild burnt character. Low hop profile.  Full bodied mouthfeel. Smooth.  Along with the roasted sweetness in the flavor I pick up a hint of the 10.5% booze. There is a charcoal like character too and a semi-dry finish. A wonderful Imperial Stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Fantastic beer that I’ve been waiting to get my hands on for a while - indeed it’s everything I had hoped for. Nice thick oily black color with minimal head and no lacing, but still looked great. Smells deeply of dark chocolate, roast coffee, dark sweet fruit and vanilla. Tastes of dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, plum, raisin, molasses, vanilla, caramel, malt and something else...graham cracker? Delicious. Nice smooth, sticky, creamy mouthfeel. Good amount of carbonation. The high ABV doesn’t hit you upfront and this beer is dangerously, deceptively easy to drink. Truly a fantastic beer, and I will have to circle back, buy a six-pack and keep it in the beer cellar to see what happens after aging for a year or two.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: this is the freshest bell's beer in the area and probably one of the few i wouldn't give a damn if it was fresh or not. heavy pour into a tulip showed a thick puddle of black mud with a slim tease of a head. immediately a ton of roasted and charred malts hit, ton of chocolate and vanilla. flavor is dense, lot of different things happening from chocolate/coffee roastiness to some sweet vanilla and bits of fruit, all wrapped up in a blanket of an earthy hop bitterness. fills the mouth and leaves a bit of a boozy warmth but not enough to stop it from going down way faster than a 10.5% stout should. gonna pick up a couple more to hide away for a few years. that unlimited shelf life is going to be put to the test
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours a pitch black color with a finger width foamy head. Head retention is good. Lacing is very good. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and some java. Creamy chocolate taste with roasty goodness and some java bitterness. Very smooth beer. Heavy bodied with moderate carbonation.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Date: Bottled on 09/10/18, sampled on 10/18/18.  Apperance: Pours inky black with no real head to speak of.  Aroma: Brownie batter like fudgy chocolate, sweet roasted malts, and tons of vanilla. I mean wow, there is a lot of vanilla here. It smells sweet, a bit like Prairie Paradise, just to that level of sweetness. I also gets some milky caramel notes.  Taste: The taste is big sweet vanilla up front with some chocolate hitting as well, but then the beer just does a swan dive into dark malt roast and bitter coffee char that really lingers. The mouthfeel is correspondingly thick and a little chewy. I like the duality of this one, one side keeping the other in check... or not. Dr. Jekyll's brew? As the beer warms even more, a marshmallow flavor rises up. Also, I have previously had this beer with about a year and a half on it and it was fantastic, with all of the above plus additional notes of dark rum soaked dates and raisins. So kids, by a six pack and be sure to tuck at least three away for 2020.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Had this tonight as part of a four year vertical tasting. Each pour was into a wine glass with a rich dark body and not much of a dark tan head which may have been caused by the bottles being opened earlier. Smell was richly chocolate and roasty malt with a slight bitterness that faded with each successive year. Taste followed the smell and was very enjoyable; with each successive year the bitterness faded and was replaced by dark fruit flavors while the chocolate was unabated. Mouthfeel was just fine.  I bought a six of this to age previously and, after drinking the current year, was wondering why bother not drinking it now. The vertical tasting answered that and then some.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: I'm a bit late to enter this into my New Beer Sunday, so I guess I'll just give it a good ol' straight-up review... I've been a big fan of Bell's darker beers that I've been able to get my hands on since we've started to see distribution over in New England. This is a beloved RIS, and one that I've never before been able to weigh in on. Super glad to get my hands on a single bottle! I had Black Note last week and thought it was great, but I definitely felt like I didn't quite know where it was coming from. This beer is the missing piece that I need to experience to put it all together!  Pours an intensely-dark color with a thin but very retentive mocha-colored head. Solid lace forms as I sip, giving this a really solid appearance. It reminds me of the very first few batches of Clown Shoes' Blaecorn Unidragon, a similarly huge RIS that went straight for the style.  The nose is incredibly roasty, with a big chocolate and caramel aspect that inevitably falls behind the roast. Caramel maltiness and Belgian chocolate round everything out. There's very little dark fruit compared to other Russian Imperial stout beers... this is all about the cocoa and earthiness! Hops seem relegated to backing up said earthy elements, but also seem to give off some herbal and floral character. Mostly sweet caramel and chocolate, though... a very decadent smelling RIS.  The flavor profile is sweeter than expected, with strong elements of Belgian chocolate, earthy hops and caramel/toffee. My tongue is utterly inundated by the intense roasty cocoa flavors here... it's almost too much; beyond the realm of what I want in this style of beer. Just absolutely decadent with pine-like bitterness following through and a bit of a floral element kicking around toward the finish. I'm unsure of whether or not this beer is really what I want in the RIS style, however. It tastes quite excellent, but it does have a bit too much roast for my taste.  The feel is moderately heavy with a bit more carbonation than I expected. Once again, this betrays what I assumed it would be... it is a large beer with an appropriately done body, and I get that, but it's just a little on the nose for me. I've known about this beer for a long time, and having now had it... I'm somewhat nonplussed. It's excellent for a strong stout, but maybe I would feel that it's even better with some time on it? Black Note is great with a year on it, so this is probably in the same realm.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Too bitter and black liquorice-y fresh; 3.5 - 3.75. Way better aged; I'd give it between a 4.5 and 5. Aged, it's very smooth, almost as if it contained lactose. Definitely age this one!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled 10/15/15; drank 9/2/17 @ the Yarchives.  Black/brown appearance.  A violent pour yielded a nice, noisy dark tan head; minimal lace.  Blackberry, dark chocolate, marshmallow, mild raspberry & faint fresh earth notes in the nose.  Medium thick, creamy mouthfeel.  Dark chocolate, blackberry & marshmallow flavors up front; fresh earth & mild raspberry notes on the finish. No booze heat.  2 years in this is a delicious, complex monster. I bet in another year it will be even better...
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Great stout! Chocolate notes throughout. Wanted more of a head to showcase the aroma more.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Deep black with a dark brown head. Strong complex full beer. Taste of coffee, chocolate, dried fruit. The taste is intense, alcohol comes through. A great stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours out pitch black with a brown head. Head is somewhat dense and has moderate retention. Lacing is minimal and splotchy.  Getting dark fruits and chocolate. Raisins come to mind. There is also a hint of coffee. Alcohol on this one is noticeable.  Taste is off roasted coffee and grains with a raisin sweetness and an alcohol warmth. It is fairly sweet. Chocolate is also part of the show.  Mouthfeel is full bodied and quite silky. Coats the palate nicely. The carbonation is medium and gives it a little lift.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Just purchased this in a flight at Decatur Brew works along with their Hells Hillow raspberry porter. Both did not disappoint! Expedition Stout is one of my favorites and continues to be !
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 355 ml bottle, kindly shared by gunnar. ABV 10.5%. Pitch black colour, low head. Strong and intense aroma of heavily roasted malts, cigar box, burnt caramel and oak. Equally strong and intense flavour, again heavily roasted malts, burnt caramel and oak. Pretty impressive stuff.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Draught 12oz snifter at Frisco Taphouse in Columbia, MD
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled 8/31/2017. Bought a few six packs of this a couple years ago. Thought I'd let some age awhile, but it's colder than a witch tit tonight and the furnace is giving me problems so I'm counting on this to warm me up. Here we go...  Pours a deep, oily black with minimal cocoa-colored head that never really dissipates. Love the scent coming off this thing. It smells deeply of bitter baker's chocolate with a boozy bite that almost gives it a barrel-aged vibe. Vague cherry cordial undertones. Just lovely and inviting. Tastes of super dark-roast (almost burnt) coffee and dark chocolate that finishes with a bitter bite. Mouth is chewy in the way that I like big imperial stouts to be. I'm partial to this style, but this is fucking delicious.  Got 10 of these left and am thinking of trying one every six months or so from here on out. Will update notes accordingly. I've heard that 4-5 years of age is the sweet spot. We'll see; it can't get a whole lot better.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Appearance: black as night; dark tan head that thins out to a ring around the glass  Aroma: smells roasty and chocolatey; malty and rich; some coffee in there; dark fruit  Taste: oooh…nice dark fruit flavors all the way through; nice bready/malty flavor up front; a hint of coffee, then a dark chocolate explosion; great roasty finish; leaves dry and a bit bitter, just begging for another sip; delicious  Mouthfeel: silky, smooth, and perfect; thick; perfect carbonation  Overall Impression: oh my goodness…this is a truly wonderful beer; rich, bold, extremely complex, and incredibly well-balanced; it is silky and oh-so-smooth; really pumped to have one that’s been aged a while  From notes taken on 11/26/2012
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Speiglau Stout glass.  Look is absolutely pitch black with a dark brown head.  Aroma is roast malt and soy sauce.  Taste is more of that intense malt.  So good
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Another thanks to Craig for this 2015 bottle...  Expedition Stout pours black as sin even coming out of the bottle. Chestnut highlights give it a little glow, and a thin espresso foam barely shows itself off despite a heavy hand.  Heavy roast is first and foremost. A combination of over toasted bread, dark roast coffee, and for the first time in my life, I'm finally getting what I have heard over and over again with some aged stouts...soy sauce. Brown sugar and a little savory spice top it off.  Very rarely do the aroma and flavors seem to match perfectly for me, but Expedition Stout does just that. With a little addition of dark chocolate and a splash of clean booze, this is really enjoyable. This 'soy' experience is working for me, especially thanks to my love for and in this case perceived salinity.  It feels right. Rich and smooth, sticky, sappy, with a nice roasty bitter finish. The alcohol warmth is perfect. Not too intense, but makes itself known.  Most of Bells offering I think are great. This one is in their top tier for me. With so much attention going to bourbon barrel aged and adjunct stouts, it's always a pleasure to enjoy a true imperial stout in it's intended raw form. Cheers, and thanks again Craig.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12oz bottled 8/31/17 poured into a snifter at fridge temp 10.5% ABV. The beer pours dense black with mocha brown head that recedes to a thin ring and leaves a little lacing. The aroma is dark chocolate and roasted malt. As it warms, the fruit and raisin aroma comes through. The taste is dark bitter roasted and chocolate malt. There is a bit of dark fruit and booze in there as well. Mouthfeel is full bodied, adequately carbonated and surprisingly dry and clean in the finish. Overall, excellent. This beer can be what you want it to be. Very bitter and raw fresh or mellow as it ages. Recommended.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12oz bottle into Libbey tulip Bottled on 8/31/17...5 months ago L- pours a midnight black, with a nice dark brown head, that dissapates into a ring of lacing S-dark chocolate, sweet dark fruits, slight roastiness T- black chocolate, sweet molasses, dark fruit, subtle coffee on finish F- this beer is smooth drinking despite 10.5% ABV, has a nice thick feel to it as well Overall this is a very drinkable Imperial Stout, that is way too sweet for my liking. This is relatively fresh at about 5 months, looking forward to drinking my 2015 vintage soon
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: I’m feelin’ buzzed and it’s all because... Yep! Raul got himself some Bell’s Expedition and he is ok with that.  Dark like the lump of coal I got in my stocking in the 4th grade (it was a bad year, my peeps) yet aromatic enough with bitter chocolate and coffee... Raul is like, “Ok, let’s dig a bit deeper.”  So the Raul man digs, and he sips, and he’s like, “Yeah, it’s aite. But it ain’t no FIS.” Flavor is there, but like my baby mama, it’s also a bit ornery, hot, and insipid.  Throw Bells Expedition Stout out of bed for eating crackers? No no no. But if I had my first choice in who I’d like to invite, FIS would get my vote instead.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled 8/31/17. Reviewed 1/18/18. Rich, malty, aroma; dark fruit and chocolate. Deep black color with a 1/2 inch tan-to-brown head, receding fairly slowly, leaving thick lacing down the side of the glass. Thick, creamy feel. Chocolate and dark fruit (but less fruit in the taste than in the aroma), mild start with a nicely bitter middle and finish. You can tell this is a strong beer, but the alcohol is well-controlled in the taste. Just a very slight burn in the finish.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Poured from a single-serve into a stout glass  Pours opaque and motor-oil thick with a fantastic, two-finger, tan, foamy head and outstanding sticky lacing.  The aromas are super and complex. Multiple types of chocolate (cocoa, semi-sweet, and cake batter at various levels); dark fruits; toasted marshmallow; char; and just a hint of booze.  The flavors may be even more complex and nuanced than the nose. Chocolate on multiple levels, sweet, semi-sweet, and bitter, with hints of coffee (but not too much); dark fruits (fig, raisin) and dark cherries steal the show. The char is less pronounced on the palate than it is on the nose. The booze is definitely there, but it's a pleasing warming note, not a burning one.  The mouthfeel is simultaneously thick, chewy, and viscous, and eminently drinkable thanks to some extra carbonation and just the right amount of dryness. It never gets cloying or too sweet.  This RIS is right there at the top of the list. I've had RIS's that are better at certain attributes than this one, but the total package here it tough to beat. It is one of the best beers I've had lately, if not ever.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Excellent at 24 months plus.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12oz bottle into a tulip. bottled 9/28/16, so 15 months old.  jet black body, dark tan head, really nice lacing initially. faint carbonation up the sides of the tulip.  Nice and plummy dried fruit aroma.  taste is quite strongly molasses. medium roasted malt on the back end, dark fruit and faint chocolate notes. ever so slightly smoky and bitter. excellent taste.  mouth gets pretty close to full. finish is slightly sweet with roasted malts around the edge of the tongue and faintly bitter in the back of the mouth. 10.5abv isn't all that noticeable.  Overall, really enjoyable RIS. Happy to have the rest of the 6 pack for the next few weeks.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Bottled 9/13, drank 12/17
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Wicked stout. Never thought motor oil could taste so good. Not a sessionible beer but a perfect night cap.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12 oz. bottled on 9/11/15 poured into a two brothers snifter  Black with a brown sugar head. Big bubbles and lacing on the glass. Sweet chocolate and roasted malt on the nose. Taste follows the smell with a pleasant bitter sweet chocolate finish and some coffee. Mouth feel is fudge with a heavy body. 2 years has mellowed the bitterness present in this beer when fresh. A great stout. Great for cellaring.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Another one that got ticked years ago, but was never reviewed. Fresh 2017 bottle to tulip glass. Pour is a jet black color with several fingers of thick, rich mocha head. Lots of spidery lacing left behind. Aroma is dark and roasty, with a boozy tinge. Flavors are big on roast and figs and plums, with a bitter bite and boozy undertones befitting the style. Thicker feel. Quite a nice companion to the Breakfast Stout I had earlier.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Exceptional stout. Very rich, but not overwhelming. Definitely not a session brew, but you won't need it with this one, very satisfying. Definitely will be back for more Looks as a stout should, smell not too strong, very pleasant. Taste very rich, very smooth feel and easy to drink, but filling, not one to overindulge on.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pouring from a 12 oz. bottle into a snifter. This is a fresh bottle. September of 18. This beer pours out thick like motor oil. It's black and forms a beautiful mocha/caramel colored crown about a pinky width. The smell is roasty and sweet. The sweetness brings in nice notes of chocolate and molasses. It also has a detectable hop bitterness. The taste comes in the same way. Full of roastiness with a slightly creamy body. Hop bitterness there and the sweetness remains. Just always an amazing treat and such a classic.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours jet black with brownish looking head that fades. Plenty of lacing and legs on the glass sides. Smells of dark roast coffee with dark fruitscarmalized brown sugar, cocoa, and earthy hops. Alcohol notes are ther in aroma, but not hot or solvent. Tastes dark & chewy with notes of burnt chocolate, coffee, cocoa, and dark fruits. Feels full bodied with a lingering bitterness and a lastin dark chocolate aftertaste.  A strong, intense RIS that is full of complex flavors but could use a little aging to let the flavors meld a little and mellow out a bit.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: The hops were much stronger than I expected. Hoping to get another one of these age it and try it again.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours dark brown, almost black with a modest head that isn’t much lighter. Very pleasant aroma of chocolate & brown sugar, a hint of smoke. Taste is mildly salty & bitter with alcohol hotness, where did the sweetness go? Flavor is chocolate & dark fruit, coffee flavored bitterness. Thick & well carbonated. Rich & complex, Kansas outstanding RIS.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours a jet black color with about a finger of light brown head that slowly fades away. Smell is coffee, chocolate, malts, and a little vanilla. Taste is chocolate, smoke, and dark fruit, I'm thinking plum. Mostly chocolate flavor. Finish is oak and smoke, with a dry, smokey lingering flavor. Hint of alcohol. Thick, creamy brew, definitely a sipper. Love the feel of this beer.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Had this fresh, amazing stout. Will be aging a few since it's shelf life is forever but not sure how aging can improve an already tastey brew.  Dark in appearance with a creamy, smoky, roasted malts chocolate, burnt coffee loaded goodness. Possibly the best RIS I've had and one of Bells finest.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Packaged 8/31/17 consumed on 11/12/17. I definitely look forward to letting this one age. Still an awesome beer when consumed during it’s earlier stages!  Jet black beer in a glass, tan head.  Smell of dark chocolate, black coffee, smokey with a bit of vanilla and dark fruits (mainly fig and raisin). Taste follows in suit, although I get a kind of beef jerky flavor that is not present in the aroma. This brew is complex!  Overall a very smooth brew, one that I enjoy very much and will come back to. Can’t wait to have one this thanksgiving with a slice of pecan pie.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: In a snifter, on tap, pours a dark mahogany black, creamy 1 finger khaki head with decent retention and good lacing. Nose is quite roasty and a little smoky, with good malt character, solid baker’s chocolate, a little sweet cream, a little (but not much) bitter coffee. Good, but for the style, nothing too special. Taste is a little more interesting to me, with a little leathery licorice and some fleshy dark fruit complementing the predominant slightly chewy chocolate, and a zippy hoppy edge that affects the feel more than it does the taste. A little smoke lingers. Fairly light feel and not very boozy, considering the abv. Can’t believe I haven’t rated this before. Solid offering, and more than well-well worth a shot.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours a dark black with a dark brown head. Smells of sweet chocolate, roasted malts, light hops, and coffee. Tastes of bitter hops, heavily roasted malt, burnt coffee, chocolate, cocoa powder, a lot of alcohol, and some very light sweetness. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Overall it's a very good RIS, I just wish the alcohol were a little less apparent.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours black with tan head and sticky lacing. Nose is chocolate, prune, oats, and smokey tones. The taste is very nice, a sweet chocolate with semi bitter flavors, some oak/smoke flavors and mild dryness on finish. Overall a very enjoyable stout, loads of flavors that just get better as the beer warms, very well made and recommend highly.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 12oz bottle poured into glass. The color is black with a thin brown head. The aroma is, prunes, rasins and dark chocolate. It tastes like dark chocolate, rasins, prunes, and smoke. The smoke taste stands out to me. This beer feels heavy due to the abv. Overall this is a world class beer. This beer is worth trying multiple times, might save some to age.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This is a very complex stout. It has all the flavors. Chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, smoke and not too much of any one. They say it ages well and I would expect so. It could go for a little smoothing out and just seems like a beer screaming for a year on it. I don't know if I can make any bottles last that long though, as it's already very good fresh. Good job bell's, keep the good beer coming.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: In the past month, I’ve tried 3 different versions of this beer; a 2015 version (aged 2 years), 2017 version (aged 3 months), and fresh out of the tap at Bell’s Brewery in Kalamazoo, MI. By far, the beer with the most flavor and depth is the one that was aged for threee months in the bottle. The other 2 felt thinner. I’m glad I tried the bottled version from this year; this beer was a little disappointing other at the 2 other stages of aging.  Drink at 3 months!
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours out very dark cola brown, and looks pitch black in the glass, with no light coming through even at the edges. Completely black. The head is brown and creamy, very thick and mocha-like. Retention is very good, and a fluffy ring remains 20 minutes later. The edges of the head leaves sheets of wiry, creamy lacing. The nose offers deep savory umami, dark chocolate with caramel, cocoa butter, some more bitter cocoa powder, gingerbread, molasses, licorice, espresso beans, raisin, allspice, prune, date, and fig. The palate immediately opens up with that soy sauce, beef broth, umami impression. A salty meatiness that causes mouthwatering. Tons of spices, dark fruits, and a huge bready presence follow. The molasses, licorice, and star anise give way to gingerbread, fruitcake, and rye bread with lots of raisin, dried fig, prune, and date. The massive bready malts of the mid-palate give way to a rich dark chocolate and bitter cocoa flavor with intense dark roast coffee. Finishes slightly sweet at first with rich dark chocolates, but the bitterness lingers, tasting continually of bitter chocolate and coffee beans. The mouthfeel is super smooth and creamy throughout, almost like a milkshake saved for the medium-minus to medium carbonation that pushes the beer along the palate fast enough to make it insanely and dangerously drinkable. The balance is both bitter and sweet, but enough of either to enhance the drinkability and noteworthiness of flavors. Overall...yes, this is a world-class stout. It's damn good and worth every penny.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: drinking this at 1 year old. this is excellent stuff, great looking brew with aromas and flavors of sweet chocolate, burnt malt, molasses, roasted nuts, coffee, bitter chocolate/espresso thing. excellent balance between sweet and roasty/bitter notes, very well rounded. solid mouthfeel and not a hint of the alcohol.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This one is more bitter and charred than what some RIS beers. If you're a hophead then this may be a beer for you, but I prefer more sweetness in a RIS. I figured 2 years in the cellar might have reduced the bitterness, but I really don't think it has. Let's give it one more year and see what happens. I'd rather spend my money on Old Rasputin if you're after a true RIS, personally. It's plenty good, but overpriced.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: A - Opaque black pour, just a finger of tan head that stuck around. S - Caramel, smoky, molasses. T - Same as the nose, very intense. M - Full bodied, sticky, medium amount of carbonation. O - Very smooth and enjoyable, but somehow just not that interesting. Drink again, but not gonna seek it out at $3.25/bottle. I suspect that aging this beer may do it some favors, I'll try to find a cellared version.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pitch black with caramel colored foam around edge of glass. Smokey, roasty, malty… very dark and some mild chocolate in there. Solid mouthfeel. My favorite non-ba, non adjunct stout.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours black with tiny beige head. The aroma is burnt malts, molasses, chocolate, dark fruit, with a little bit of molasses. The flavor is intensely bitter dark roasted malts with a big dark fruit and chocolate coming in midpalate. It finishes dry with bitter burnt malt that seems a little stale. The mouthfeel thick and coating, probably the bright spot of the beer. Overal, this is an overrated beer. It's one of the few classics I just don't get.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours black with a well retained half inch tan head that settled to a ring and left lots of lacing. Smells of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and molasses. Tastes of dark chocolate, espresso, roasted malts, figs, raisins, molasses, some hops on the finish and a bit of char. Full bodied, creamy, thick mouth feel, appropriately carbonated for the style, finishes dry.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Looks like motor oil Smells like cherry, dates, and alcohol Tastes sweet like dark chocolate up front followed by strong espresso coffee. Feels thick and full, quite a mouthful. Overall very smooth and enjoyable. The taste lingers a long time.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: 500th beer. Been waiting to put this review in until i hit 500 on here. I've had it years ago and i continue to yearly. My favorite beer  Pours black. Thick, short, light brown head lasts a little while. Lasting ring.  Smells dark fruit, roast malt, dark chocolate, earthy hops, mollases, light coffee. So complex  Tastes very roasty and dark fruit, figs, molasses. Followed by earthy hops, dark chocolate and touch of coffee. Finish is dry with a roasty Linger. Full body and creamy, smooth medium carbonation.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Dark and roasty, the mouthfeel was a tad thin. Good flavors, goes down smooth, nothing offensive about this beer. Nice beer to have around, if i was in distro I'd pick it up more often.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This beer came highly recommended, so I was happy to chase down some to try. I didnt age it - so that may be part of the issue. Exciting pour. Very nice color, really up on this beer. Then the taste. Plug tobacco. Thats the overwhelming taste here. I enjoyed chewing plug tobacco working at an orchard in my youth, and you spit. This was waaaay too reminiscent for me, of a good plug of tobacco. Gave a second bottle a pour a couple weeks after my first - still the same. Glad I tried it, if you've chewed plug tobacco, this may not be the beer for you.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: Pours black with dark ruby highlights into a fifteen ounce glass mug the same temperature as the beer. One finger of thick mocha head that disappears half way through. Very little lacing. Some legs.  Nose is assaulted by deep dark chocolate followed closely by big expresso coffee. Dark fruits. Plum and apricot. Alcohol. Very rich. Some molasses.  Deep dark chocolate on the palate followed by expresso coffee. Huge dark roasted malts provide the necessary bitterness to offset the sweet chocolate. Dark fruits. Black walnuts. A little boozy but the creamy texture and flavor overwhelms the alcohol easily. Very earthy.  This brew is smooth as silk. Excellent carbonation.  This is a massive stout. Very complex. Impossible to describe all the aromas and flavors. Without a doubt one of the best available.
brewery_name: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store

text: This was poured into a mini snifter. The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a less than a finger’s worth of foamy tan head that dissipated within less than about 30 seconds. The smell had a big roasty to semi-smooth bitter coffee bean leading into a delicate cocoa and light vanilla to round it all out.
